alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have dissipated. However, rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches have fallen over the area from the thunderstorms. This amount of rainfall will take sometime to dissipate. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect unti 245 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Doral, Hialeah Gardens, Miami Springs and Medley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
